context_bundle.summary: Rust WebAssembly development with wasm-bindgen for JavaScript interop, wasm-pack for building, and web targets

onboarding.quick_start: cargo install wasm-pack && wasm-pack build --target web && wasm-pack test --headless --firefox
common_patterns: Setup: 'cargo new --lib mywasm && cd mywasm && cargo add wasm-bindgen'
Export function: 'use wasm_bindgen::prelude::*; #[wasm_bindgen] pub fn greet(name: &str) -> String { format!("Hello, {}!", name) }'
Build: 'wasm-pack build --target web to generate pkg/ directory'
Import in JS: 'import init, { greet } from "./pkg/mywasm.js"; await init(); console.log(greet("World"));'
JS interop: '#[wasm_bindgen] extern "C" { fn alert(s: &str); } alert("Hello from Rust!");'
Web API: 'use web_sys::console; console::log_1(&"Hello from Rust!".into());'
Async: '#[wasm_bindgen] pub async fn fetch_data() -> Result<JsValue, JsValue> { /* ... */ }'
known_errors: wasm-bindgen error: Ensure versions match between CLI and library
module not found: Check import path, ensure wasm-pack build completed
memory access out of bounds: Check array bounds, use safe Rust patterns
large wasm size: Enable LTO, strip symbols, use wasm-opt
async not working: Use wasm-bindgen-futures for async support
panic in wasm: Add console_error_panic_hook for better error messages
